body:
ahh, i see. thanks. I was puzzled by my example program where
write to *x has write barrier because the compiler doesn't know
whether it's stack slot or heap slot.

if the huge stack is not just a single frame, then i think we can be
sure that writes to bottom stack slots are using writer barriers, so
perhaps we do have a way to know if we need to scan the whole
stack or not during mark termination.
